resources.string: Central Park is the largest park in Plymouth. It was originally created in 1928 as a park devoted to the improvement of the health of city residents.
Also known as the \'People\'s Park\'. Built 150 years ago, it is the oldest formal public park in Plymouth.
Plymouth Hoe is the natural heart of Plymouth with breathtaking views across Plymouth Sound, one of the most perfect natural harbours in the world.
The largest Aquarium in the UK, the National Marine Aquarium is a conservation charity dedicated to driving the understanding of our Oceans.
This straightforward, modern hotel is 12 minutes from the National Marine Aquarium and 8 miles from Dartmoor Zoo.
The 3-star hotel boasts 135 guest rooms, a fitness suite, on-site parking (chargeable) and over 400 sqm of event space, making it ideal for business and family trips.
ZUZiMO! are us & our restaurant, tapas bar located close to the city centre and Barbican.
Two Italians from Positano, a holiday resort on the Amalfi coast, near Sorrento, came to Plymouth for six months to perfect their English. The six months has now extended itself 38 years
